A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: This was the Star Wars film that made me lose interest in the franchise.   It's never happened before with me.  For example\, I really liked the first Matrix movie\, the second one was ok\, not as interesting\, but it had more action\, and then the third one was a stinker.  I still like the first one though\, regardless how bad the third film was.  This isn't the case with TLJ\, as even over a month later\, I still don't want to watch any of the original trilogy.  \nThey could have done a lot with Phasma\, but she just get's her well-trained butt handed to her.  Finn was turned into a joke in the opening act.  I'm not going to bother to go on with complaints\, but it's like the director choose to mishandle every character on purpose.
